intro: Hugonia oreogena, commonly known as the mountain hugonia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Lygophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Hugonia oreogena is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to partial to full shade.
